utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang minus Monica is there.]

utterances.transcript: Do you think that there's a town in Missouri or some place called Sample? And ah, as you're driving into town there's-there's like a sign, and it says "You're in Sample."
utterances.transcript_with_note: Do you think that there's a town in Missouri or some place called Sample? And ah, as you're driving into town there's-there's like a sign, and it says "You're in Sample." (He says it like urine sample.)

utterances.transcript: Hey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey.

utterances.transcript: Hey!
How'd it go with Pete?!
Tell us!
You're not gonna believe this. Okay, so I go over...

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Two guys walk over and interrupt her. They're both names you've already heard. One's Billy Crystal. Yes, that Billy Crystal from City Slickers. The other one is Robin Williams. Yes, that Robin Williams from Mrs. Doubtfire.]

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry. Ex-excuse us. I'm sorry, it's a little crowded. Do you mind if we...
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm sorry. Ex-excuse us. I'm sorry, it's a little crowded. Do you mind if we... (motions to the couch)

utterances.transcript: Yeah, could you scooch?
Yeah, move over just a little bit.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Rachel, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey all scooch over to let them sit down.)

utterances.transcript: Keep on scooching.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [cut to Monica telling the gang about what happened at Pete's]

utterances.transcript: So guys, listen, I go over there, and umm...

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Robin interrupts her again by complaining loudly to Billy as the camera cuts to them.)

utterances.transcript: Why? Why?! What's wrong with me?!
What's the matter?
I have a feelin'... I, my wife is sleeping with her gynaecologist.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (The gang is now eaves dropping in on the conversation, and is shocked.)

utterances.transcript: How do you know?
Well y'know, he's got access.
Yeah.
Y'know it's that feeling you get, y'know?
Like when you go bowling and you know you're in somebody else's shoes?
That's the one.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [cut back to the gang.]

utterances.transcript: All right, so, so you went to Pete's...
What happened?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Robin is speaking loudly again) I...
[cut to Billy and Robin]

utterances.transcript: Why is this happening to me?! I don't know, maybe it's my wound.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [cut to the gang]

utterances.transcript: Forget it.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Forget it. (they all turn and listen to Billy and Robin)

utterances.transcript: So it's-it's not heeled yet?
No-no, it's ooozing, oozing. Could you pass me the cream? Is there any-Oh, there's the cream.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No-no, it's ooozing, oozing. (to Rachel) Could you pass me the cream? Is there any-Oh, there's the cream.

utterances.transcript: Thomas, this is gonna be hard, but I wanted it to come from me, and nobody else.

It's me, I've been sleeping with your wife.
So you're the gynaecologist?

utterances.transcript: Hey, I'm trying to have a private conversation! Is that okay?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Joey) Hey, I'm trying to have a private conversation! Is that okay?!

utterances.transcript: Ooh, Can I have a napkin, please? Could you please hand me a napkin? Would you--Give me this thing all right!! Enough! And you are no longer my friend! We are finished! Nada!! No more! You are a bastard for doing this!! Get away from me!!

Anything but stew.

plots: Phoebe asks Rachel if Phoebe can set Ross up with Bonnie ; Rachel agrees since Bonnie 's the girl who shaves her head ; Later , Rachel finds out Bonnie now has plenty of hair .
Phoebe introduces Bonnie , who Phoebe sets up with Ross , to Rachel .
When Rachel asks for info about Bonnie , Phoebe tells Rachel that Bonnie was bald , to which Rachel consents .
When Rachel meets Bonnie at the coffee house , however , Rachel finds out that Bonnie has grown Bonnie 's hair back and is beautiful .
Rachel 's angry with Phoebe for lying to Rachel about Bonnie , but Phoebe corrects Rachel by saying that Bonnie was bald , and that Bonnie 's not any more .

utterances.transcript: Hey! It's me. Mon-i-ca! Can I just tell you how proud I am of you.

utterances.transcript: It would be nice after hearing 20,000 people chant "You suck!"
I mean I-I thought you were nuts at first, but you-you did it. And now you can just look back at this thing with no regrets.

Well, you're not gonna get going are you?
Well let me ask you a question. Am I the Ultimate Fighting Champion?
Well, no. But...

That guy stood on your neck until you passed out!

Let me tell you a story. When I set out to create Moss 865, do you think it just happened overnight? You didn't know that already?
Look, I'm gonna get better. Okay? I promise you.
Okay, just get a lot better. Fast.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's balcony, Ross and Phoebe are grilling some burgers and hot dogs.]

utterances.transcript: Hey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (joining them) Hey.

utterances.transcript: Hey! How long until Pete's fight?
Oh, about five minutes. Right now they're interviewing his opponent. Apparently he trains by going to Iran and pulling the arms off thieves.
Hot dog?
Four, please. I'm really nervous. Thank you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Four, please. (Ross looks at her) I'm really nervous. (Ross gives her the four dogs) Thank you. (she grabs four buns, and heads back inside)

utterances.transcript: So Ross, how umm, how did it go with Bonnie?
What? Oh! I gotta tell you, I-I wasn't expecting to like her at all, I mean I actually wasn't expecting to like anyone right now, but she's really terrific.
Ohh, that's too bad!
No, I-I'm saying I liked her.
Yeah, y'know what, there are other fish in the sea.
Pheebs, I think she's great. Okay? We're going out again.
Okay, I hear you! Are you capable of talking about any thing else?
Hey! Which one's my turkey burger?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (joining them) Hey! Which one's my turkey burger?

utterances.transcript: Ahh, the one next to my foot. Sorry.
Hey, the fight's starting!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sticking his head out the window) Hey, the fight's starting!

utterances.transcript: Okay, we'll be right in. So ah, did your boss try to slap you again today?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, we'll be right in. (to Chandler) So ah, did your boss try to slap you again today?

utterances.transcript: Nine times! Okay, I had to put on lotion! But, it's gonna be okay, because as of tomorrow I'm conducting an experiment, and if all goes as planned, my butt will be smack free.
Fight's over!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sticking his head out the window) Fight's over!
(Chandler, Ross, and Phoebe all stop dead in their tracks at the news.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler's office, Chandler is confronting his boss about the butt smacking thing. His boss is writing on a white board.]

utterances.transcript: Excuse me, Doug? Hey there sports fan!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Excuse me, Doug? (no reaction) Hey there sports fan!!

utterances.transcript: Bing! You got those numbers for me?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (turning around) Bing! You got those numbers for me?

utterances.transcript: No, I ah, I didn't do them.
Oh, you forgot?
No, no I just ah, didn't do them. Instead, I ah, hung out with a couple of friends and had a couple of beers so I certainly don't deserve any praise, verbal or otherwise.
Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi Bridge never looked smaller. That's okay, you're still my number one guy! Bing!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi Bridge never looked smaller. (laughs) That's okay, you're still my number one guy! (slaps him on the butt) Bing!

utterances.transcript: Doug!!
Hmm.
I'm a little bit uncomfortable with the that way you express yourself.
Oh, is it the swearing? I mean is it the constant swearing? Because I gotta tell ya, if it is, you can just... kiss my ass!
No, no. It-it's not about the swearing, it's more about ah, the way, that you ah, occasionally, concentrate, your enthusiasm on my buttock.
Oh?
Oh, and don't get me wrong, I appreciate the sentiment. It's just that I, I have a rather, sensitive posterior, and ah, besides, it's making all the other guys jealous.
Well, say no more. Y'know it takes guts to bring this up. Bing! You're okay.
Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. (he starts to leave)

utterances.transcript: Ha! Ahhhhhhh!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ha! (goes to smack him on the butt, but stops, faking Chandler out) Ahhhhhhh!

utterances.transcript: Ahhhhh!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ahhhhh! (walks out, imitating shooting himself in the head)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are talking and walking.]

utterances.transcript: Okay. Would you rather live in the shirt pocket of a sweaty giant, or inside his shower drain?
Oh my God! Phoebe look, it's Ross and that girl.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (seeing Ross and Bonnie inside Central Perk) Oh my God! Phoebe look, it's Ross and that girl.
(We see Ross and Bonnie laughing and having a good time.)

utterances.transcript: No! No! Look at that! It's a line of ants! They're working as a team!
utterances.transcript_with_note: No! No! Look at that! (drags her away from the window) It's a line of ants! They're working as a team!

utterances.transcript: Phoebe!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Phoebe! (goes back to the window)

utterances.transcript: Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is breaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let's go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (looking in the window) Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is breaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let's go.

utterances.transcript: Come on Phoebe, look at that! They are not breaking up, look at them. Okay that's, you know what that is? That is a, that is a second date, that's what that is! Look at that, she just put her hand on his thigh...
Oh no! That really is nothing, she is very sexually aggressive.
Ohh! Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now he loves her, he's gonna marry her, and this is all your fault.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ohh! (walking away from the window) Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now he loves her, he's gonna marry her, and this is all your fault.

utterances.transcript: You said it was okay!
You said she was bald!!
What?! What-what-what-what-what?!!
Phoebe, we can't, we just can't just let it happen! Okay, we have to do something! We have to break them up! Okay? Just go in there and like, shave her head! You owe me one bald girl!!
Okay, first of all, breathe. Second of all, I don't get it. Aren't you the one that decided that you didn't want to be with Ross?
Yes.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (quietly) Yes.

utterances.transcript: Well isn't he your friend? Don't you want him to be happy?
Yes.
So?
I just y'know, I didn't expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff. Ooo-ooh!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I just y'know, I didn't expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff. Ooo-ooh! (sits down on the curb)

utterances.transcript: Oh no.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sits down next to her and hugs her) Oh no.

utterances.transcript: What?
Oh, we killed them all.
Oh!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both jump up and wipe off their butts.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: A locker room, Pete is in a full upper-body cast. Monica enters, sees him, and gasps. Pete tries to turn around, and winces in pain.]

utterances.transcript: It's okay, it's not as bad as it looks, it's a precaution. Ah, I'm not supposed to move my spine.
Please tell me you're stopping now.
I'm fine! I'd fight tonight, if they'd let me. See this circle I'm marking off here? This is my zone of terror.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm fine! I'd fight tonight, if they'd let me. (stands up and starts swinging his arms) See this circle I'm marking off here? This is my zone of terror.

utterances.transcript: You are insane! You-you gotta give this up!

I can't until I'm the ultimate fighter. I will do it. I'm telling you, the day will come when children will argue over who will win a fight, me or Superman. Now, I'm not saying I could beat Superman, but y'know, kids are stupid.
Sit down. All right? Please, just listen to me. You are terrible at this! Okay? You are the worst ultimate fighter ever! Ever!!
Y'know I have a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture in my right forearm, and a severely bruised Adam's Apple, but that really hurt.
Well then, y'know what? I care about you to much to watch you hurt yourself like this. So if you have to do this, then you're gonna have to do it without me.
Well if you're asking me to quit, then you're asking me to be someone I'm not. I've got to do this.
Then I've gotta go. Bye.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Then I've gotta go. Bye. (kisses him and starts to walk out)

utterances.transcript: Mon-Monica?
Yes?
Could you leave a note? 'Cause I'm on a lot of pain killers now, and I don't know if I'll remember this tomorrow.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Could you leave a note? 'Cause I'm on a lot of pain killers now, and I don't know if I'll remember this tomorrow. (She leaves.)
